question: 8 (c)
statement_html:
Use the first three terms of the series in part (a) to find a numerical approximation of the integral shown below:

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle \int_{0}^{1}e^{-x^{2}}\,dx\end{aligned}\]

Leave the answer in terms of fractions rather than decimals.
statement_latex:
Use the \textbf{first three terms} of the series in
{part
(a)} to find a numerical approximation of the integral shown below:

\begin{align*}
\displaystyle \int_{0}^{1}e^{-x^{2}}\,dx
\end{align*}

Leave the answer in terms of fractions rather than decimals.
statement_raw:
Use the '''first three terms''' of the series in [[Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH103/April_2005/Question_08_(a)|part (a)]] to find a numerical approximation of the integral shown below:

:<math> \displaystyle \int_{0}^{1}e^{-x^{2}}\,dx</math>

Leave the answer in terms of fractions rather than decimals.
